result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E Simily

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Michael E Simily in court, in custody without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - asking for more time to get the governor's warrant
Deft - would like counsel
Court - schedules new date, bond continues
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on November 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:32 PM Defendant Michael E Simily in court in custody from DCJ.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Lundeen - contesting extradition
State - requesting One Million Dollar cash bond.
Atty Lundeen - argues DE has lived in Menomonie his entire life. 
State - needs 60 days to prove identification. Status in 30 days.
Court - orders $10,000 cash bond
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
